publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQR 9

seg.seg: Was auch immer für Glanzvolle in der Welt [sind], du (eben) hast diese alle übertroffen.
Whatever splendid ones [there are] in the world, (precisely) you have surpassed all these.

p.note: The original manuscript is missing. It consisted of two fragments that were proved to belong together by the parallel .

list.item: a1 ·[s]k·m· p[e]rn(e)rñ(e)sa y· – – – – – – /// a2 tse [20]-2 pernerñesa l(a)lya[s]ta n[e]tt[e]-(sū)t_r_a [aka]lṣlyeśc\ yam(ṣ)ac\ pe[rne] /// a3 _r_añcmeṃ dīrka[nak]ī (_k_aṣṣi) [t]w[e] aknat[s]añe yai[ka]sta kakawu po kle[śa](nma pe)rn(e)[rñe](sa) w[ī]na[s](k)[au] /// a4 20-3 po pernentaṃ ṣe[ṣ]irku pernerñesa snaiy olypo [la]laikau po pernesa – – – rñai kleśa[nma pe] a5 rnerñeṣe sumersa [_t_a]prauñenta[t_s\] (_t_a)[r]ne(ne) ś[m]ās[ta] – [ṣmeṃ] snai wace (p)o – – – – – ·au – – b1 – _r_anmasa onolm[e](ṃ) pern(e)[r]ñ(e)mpa [r· t(·)·]sta y[a]kt(e) [p](er)ñ[e] w· k· m· – – – – – – – – – – b2 śtasta śatkalye pernerñeṣ[ai] onolmet_s\ pontat_s\ [_k_ar]tse[ś]c(\) alalcu tañ\ perne[r]ñ[e] (winā)skau 20-5 [k]_u(s)e [k]sa b3 perneñca śaiṣe[n]e (tw)e (no) po ceṃ ṣarkatai piś\ cmelaṣeṃ onolme[t_s\] pe(rnerñeś\) ṣe[_k\] spelkesu [śau] b4 _l_anmaṣe pitosa ce p(e)rnerñe kraupatai tañ\ pernerñe saim yamo_ṣ pe(rneñcä\ ka po klautkār)e [20] – [pe](rn)[e] b5 r[ñ]enta aiṣeñcai trai(dhā)[tuk p]o saṃ(sārṣṣet_s\ ceclu) _ṣ_a[r] kau[c\] (p)ernenta [yt·] ///
The original manuscript is missing. It consisted of two fragments that were proved to belong together by the parallel [[THT 204]].
